title: Stalls / Rough Idle
description: Diagnose rough idle, stalling, and poor low-speed running on the Kymco People S 125i scooter.

nodes.text: How does the idle issue present on your People S 125i?

options.text: Stalls when coming to a stop

nodes.instructions: Warm the engine fully (3-5 minutes). The People S 125i should idle at 1,500-1,700 RPM. Locate the idle adjuster on the throttle body. Turn clockwise to raise, counterclockwise to lower. Adjust until smooth without stalling.

Access the air filter on the People S 125i — remove the air box cover. If the filter is clogged with dirt or oil-soaked, it restricts airflow causing rich running and rough idle. This is one of the most common and overlooked causes. Replace every 4,000-6,000 km.

nodes.warning: Do not spray flammable chemicals near hot engine.
nodes.instructions: With the engine idling, spray contact cleaner around the intake manifold boot between throttle body and cylinder head. If idle changes when spraying, you found the leak. Also check vacuum hoses for cracks. The rubber intake boot hardens with age.

nodes.text: Check the IACV / idle stepper motor
nodes.instructions: The People S 125i IACV controls idle air bypass. It is on the throttle body. Listen for initialization click at key-on. If clogged with carbon, remove and clean with throttle body cleaner. Make sure its electrical connector is secure.

nodes.warning: Fuel is flammable. No open flames.
nodes.instructions: Old or contaminated fuel is extremely common on scooters that sit. Fuel degrades in 30-60 days. Check freshness, smell (stale = varnish smell), and look for water or sediment. The People S 125i fuel injection is sensitive to poor fuel.
Remove and inspect. Black/sooty = rich (dirty filter or injector issue). White = lean (vacuum leak). Tan/brown = correct. Check gap (0.6-0.7mm). Replace if fouled or worn. Standard plug: NGK CR7HSA.

nodes.details: Correct idle is 1,500-1,700 RPM when warm. If it drifts again, investigate IACV or vacuum leaks.
Replace with OEM or equivalent. Check every 2,000 km, replace every 4,000-6,000 km. Immediate improvement in throttle response expected.

nodes.action: Replace cracked intake boot or damaged hose.
nodes.details: Rubber intake boot hardens with age. Replace if cracked. Tighten clamps. Reset idle after repair.
ECU needs a minute to relearn. Adjust idle if needed. Clean every 10,000 km preventatively.
Use OEM Kymco replacement. ECU needs a few idle cycles to calibrate after installation.

nodes.action: Drain old fuel, refill with fresh gasoline.
nodes.details: The People S 125i has approximately a 7-liter tank. Add injector cleaner to the first tank if fuel was very old.

nodes.warning: Water in fuel can damage injector and pump.
nodes.action: Drain all contaminated fuel and refill fresh.
nodes.details: Check fuel cap seal for cracks allowing water entry.
Gap to 0.6-0.7mm. Replace every 4,000-6,000 km. Investigate root cause if fouled.

nodes.action: Use fuel system cleaner or have injector professionally cleaned.
nodes.details: Add Techron to a full tank of fresh fuel. If persistent, the injector may need ultrasonic cleaning or replacement.
